definition: make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
(negative prefix)/not/no
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to distance oneself from (classical)
thousand
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: Many Tibetan travels thousands of miles pilgrimaging to Tsedrug each year.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有許多藏民不遠千里前來繞山朝拜。

sentences.english: Away from home when the children returned to their parents at home to travel long distances.
sentences.chinese: 離家的孩子這時要不遠千里回到父母家裏。

sentences.english: He came all the way from Egypt.
You know I'd walk a thousand miles.
You have come all the way from Paris to find me?
sentences.chinese: 你是不遠千里，從巴黎來找我的？

definition: to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to travel around many countries (idiom); peregrinations/refers to the travels of Confucius
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
Northeast China/Manchuria/lit. east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1]/Kantō region of Japan
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
long and difficult trek
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
broaden, expand one's horizons
(fame) spreads far and wide
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
two-China (policy)
to have one's wish fulfilled
to inquire into/to ask after
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
